briefTitle: An Extension Study of Teduglutide in Japanese Participants With Short Bowel Syndrome Who Completed 24 Weeks of Treatment in SHP633-306 or TED-C14-004
officialTitle: An Open-Label, Extension Study of Teduglutide in Japanese Subjects With Short Bowel Syndrome Who Completed 24 Weeks of Treatment in SHP633-306 or TED-C14-004
summary: The purpose of this clinical study is to evaluate the long-term safety and efficacy of teduglutide in Japanese participants with PN/IV (parenteral nutrition/intravenous)-dependent SBS (short bowel syndrome) who completed SHP633-306 or who were in the extension phase of the TED-C14-004 (NCT02340819) study.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Demonstrated at Least 20 Percent (%) Reduction From Baseline in Weekly Parenteral Support (PS) Volume
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Baseline (core study) up to approximately 40.2 months (duration of assessment in the current study)
